IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE ARE ONE OF THE NATION'S LARGEST JESUIT, CATHOLIC UNIVERSITIES WITH OVER 17,000 STUDENTS. WE WORK TO EXPAND KNOWLEDGE THROUGH LEARNING, JUSTICE, AND FAITH.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE ARE CHICAGO'S JESUIT, CATHOLIC UNIVERSITY - A DIVERSE COMMUNITY SEEKING GOD IN ALL THINGS AND WORKING TO EXPAND KNOWLEDGE IN THE SERVICE OF HUMANITY THROUGH LEARNING, JUSTICE, AND FAITH.
IRS990.Desc: HIGHER EDUCATION: LOYOLA UNIVERSITY CHICAGO EDUCATED APPROXIMATELY 12,500 UNDERGRADUATE & 4,900 GRADUATE & PROFESSIONAL STUDENTS FOR THE FALL TERM. LOYOLA STRIVES TO DELIVER THE PREMIER UNDERGRADUATE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE IN CHICAGO, CHARACTERIZED BY A TRANSFORMATIVE EXPERIENCE IN THE JESUIT TRADITION & A COMMITMENT TO THE UNDERSERVED. THE QUINLAN SCHOOL OF BUSINESS CONTINUES TO BE RANKED AS THE NUMBER 1 UNDERGRADATE BUSINESS PROGRAM IN CHCAGO BY U.S. NEWS & WORLD REPORT RANKINGS. SIMILARLY THE MARCELLA NIEHOFF SCHOOL OF NURSING BACHELOR OF SCIENCE PROGRAM IS RANKED IN THE TOP 5 PERCENT OF UNDERGRADUATE NURSING PROGRAMS NATIONWIDE. AT THE GRADUATE & PROFESSIONAL LEVELS, LOYOLA DELIVERS A HIGH-QUALITY EDUCATION THAT IS CHARACTERIZED BY EXCELLENCE, INNOVATION, JUSTICE, & LEADERSHIP. LOYOLA IS HOME TO 13 SCHOOLS, COLLEGES, AND VARIOUS INSTITUTES AND CENTERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HIGHER EDUCATION AUXILIARY SERVICES: LOYOLA UNIVERSITY CHICAGO PROVIDES VARIOUS SERVICES AND AMENITIES THAT STRENGTHEN AND ENHANCE THE LOYOLA STUDENT, FACULTY, AND STAFF EXPERIENCE. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE HOUSING, FOOD SERVICE, BOOKSTORES, RECREATIONAL FACILITIES, AND TRANSPORTATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: RESEARCH: LOYOLA UNIVERSITY CHICAGO ENGAGES IN EXTERNALLY FUNDED RESEARCH PROJECTS AIMED AT SOLVING CONTEMPORARY, SOCIETAL CHALLENGES, WITH THE GOAL OF CREATING A BETTER AND MORE JUST TOMORROW. THE RESEARCH IS CONDUCTED IN EACH OF LOYOLA'S THREE CHICAGO-AREA CAMPUSES (HEALTH SCIENCE CAMPUS, WATER TOWER CAMPUS, AND LAKESHORE CAMPUS) AND SERVES TO ADVANCE KNOWLEDGE WHILE ALSO PROVIDING TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE AND PROFESSIONAL (E.G., MEDICAL) STUDENTS IN THE RESEARCH PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule C, Part II-B, Line 1b PAID STAFF OF MANAGEMENT
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PHILIP D. HALE, VICE PRESIDENT FOR CIVIC ENGAGEMENT & GOVERNMENT AFFAIRS, IS REGISTERED AS A LOBBYIST WITH THE U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES, THE UNITED STATES SENATE, AND THE STATE OF ILLINOIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule C, Part II-B, Line 1g DIRECT CONTACT WITH LEGISLATORS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING FISCAL YEAR 2024, THE LOBBYING ACTIVITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY INVOLVED CONTACTS WITH LEGISLATORS AND THEIR STAFFS AT THE FEDERAL, STATE, AND CITY LEVELS. THESE CONTACTS, THROUGH OFFICE VISITS, PHONE CONVERSATIONS, AND LARGE GATHERINGS WERE PRINCIPALLY FOR PURPOSES OF GOODWILL, FOR CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING, FOR SUPPORT FOR STUDENTS AND FOR ISSUES RELATED TO STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AT THE FEDERAL AND STATE LEVELS.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: REFUNDABLE US GOV STUDENT LOAN FUNDS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part III, Line 4 DESCRIPTION AND PURPOSE OF ORGANIZATION'S ART COLLECTIONS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: As a museum with an interest in education and educational programming, the Loyola University Museum of Art (LUMA) reflects the University's Jesuit mission and is dedicated to helping men and women of all creeds explore the roots of their own faith and spiritual quest. LUMA is dedicated to exploring, promoting, and understanding art and artistic expression that attempts to illuminate the enduring spiritual questions and concerns of all cultures and societies. All of LUMA's collections are used as a part of our educational curriculum as well as our Fine & Performing Arts and Public History Programs. Martin D'Arcy, S.J. Collection The Museum interprets and displays the University's medieval and renaissance collection, known as the Martin D'Arcy, S.J. Collection. The D'Arcy is one of the Midwest's finest collections of Medieval, Renaissance, and Baroque art. It is particularly noted for its diverse holdings of three-dimensional objects that epitomize both the religious and secular aspects of European life. Devotional ivories, painted sculptures, and enameled liturgical objects feature among its medieval highlights; in covering the Renaissance, the D'Arcy is especially strong in objects commissioned to celebrate familial events such as marriage and childbirth. Among its Baroque pieces are Christ Among the Doctors by Matthias Stomer, a Dutch-born follower of Caravaggio, and intricate pieces of metalwork and woodwork, such as a collector's chest by Wenzel Jamnitzer, the leading German goldsmith of this period, and The Flagellation by Alessandro Algardi. The James and Emilia Govan Crche Collection LUMA's annual holiday exhibition, Art and Faith of the Crche: The Collection of James and Emilia Govan, continues each year with over 100 nativity scenes. These works represent only a small part of the Govans' gift, which was donated from 2009 to 2017. The first crche the Govans brought into their home came from Italy and was a gift from Jim to his wife Emilia. This present piqued an interest in crches and sparked a passion for collecting. When people learned of the Govans' interest, family and friends began to add to the collection. Over the course of almost forty years, the Govans amassed over 600 crches, representing over 100 countries. Many are unique in depicting the nativity story and incorporate elements, such as architecture, clothing, animals, gifts, and materials, that are particular to the artist's native country. Sr. Jean Dolores Schmidt, BVM Gallery A permanent exhibition honoring Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, a beloved figure who has touched the hearts of many through her unwavering faith, dedication, and spirit. This exhibition celebrates Sister Jean's remarkable life and profound impact on Loyola University Chicago and the wider community. Via a collection of personal artifacts, awards, and memorabilia, visitors will journey through her decades of service, her role as chaplain of the Loyola Ramblers, and her inspiring contributions to education and social justice. This tribute to Sister Jean reflects the values she embodies - community, resilience, and love.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part V, Line 4 INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE A STABLE SOURCE OF FUNDING FOR UNIVERSITY ACADEMIC PROGRAMS, FINANCIAL AID, AND FACULTY SUPPORT ON A LONG-TERM TIME HORIZON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part II, Line 9 Conservation easements financial reporting
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHEDULE D, PART II, LINES 5, 6, 7 AND 9 THE UNIVERSITY HAS ONE PROPERTY LISTED ON THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES: THE MUNDELEIN CENTER. THE UNIVERSITY HAS FIVE PROPERTIES THAT ARE DESIGNATED AS CHICAGO LANDMARKS: THE MADONNA DELLA STRADA CHAPEL, LEWIS TOWERS, THE MUNDELEIN CENTER, BURROWES HALL AND PIPER HALL. THERE IS NO SPECIFIC WRITTEN POLICY REGARDING THE PERIODIC MONITORING, INSPECTION, VIOLATIONS, AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE CONSERVATION EASEMENTS HELD BY THE UNIVERSITY. HOWEVER, THE OFFICE OF THE GENERAL COUNSEL AND THE UNIVERSITY'S FACILITIES DEPARTMENT ARE AWARE OF THE REGULATIONS AND RESTRICTIONS ATTACHED TO THESE BUILDINGS, AS DICTATED BY THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES, THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, AND THE COMMISSION ON CHICAGO LANDMARKS. AS SUCH, BEFORE ANY CHANGES, MODIFICATIONS OR RENOVATIONS ARE MADE TO THESE STRUCTURES, THE APPROPRIATE RULES AND REGULATIONS ARE REVIEWED AND FOLLOWED. ADDITIONALLY, THE CONSERVATION EASEMENTS RELATED TO THE AFOREMENTIONED BUILDINGS ARE NOT REPORTED IN EITHER THE BALANCE SHEET OR THE REVENUE AND EXPENSE STATEMENT OF THE UNIVERSITY, AS THERE IS NO BOOK VALUE TO THOSE EASEMENTS. THEY ARE SOLELY MEASURES IN PLACE TO PROTECT THE HISTORICAL INTEGRITY OF THE BUILDINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part IV, Line 2b Explanation of escrow agreement
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LOYOLA HOLDS ASSETS FOR VARIOUS STUDENT ORGANIZATIONS, STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS, AND THIRD-PARTY SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS IN THE AGENCY ACCOUNTS, WHICH ARE PASS-THROUGH LIABILITY ACCOUNTS WHERE ASSETS ARE HELD FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE THIRD-PARTY. LOYOLA DOES NOT CONTROL HOW THESE FUNDS ARE SPENT AND HAS THESE ACCOUNTS SET UP FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF OUTSIDE ORGANIZATIONS TO USE LOYOLA'S SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Part I, Line 3 RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY DURING FY24 THE UNIVERSITY DISPLAYED A NOTICE ABOUT ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY ON THE MAIN PAGE OF ITS WEBSITE (WWW.LUC.EDU) AT ALL TIMES, WHICH IS PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE ON THE INTERNET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON A NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS. AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TOWARDS A STUDENT'S TUITION, ROOM, AND BOARD COSTS, THEREBY ENSURING THE FUNDS ARE USED AS INTENDED. ADDITIONALLY, ANY ORGANIZATIONS AND ENTITIES RECEIVING SUBCONTRACT GRANTS FROM LOYOLA UNIVERSITY CHICAGO ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS ON THE USE OF THESE FUNDS. THESE PROGRESS REPORTS ARE MONITORED AND REVIEWED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE BEING USED APPROPRIATELY.

VP INST. DEI & CHIEF INCL. OFFICER

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a First-class or charter travel
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FIRST-CLASS TRAVEL FIRST CLASS TRAVEL WAS PROVIDED TO ONE OFFICER ON FLIGHTS WHERE FIRST CLASS AND ECONOMY WERE THE ONLY CLASSES ON THE AIRCRAFT. THE OFFICER TRAVELED FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES AND THEREFORE THE COST OF THE BUSINESS/FIRST CLASS TRAVEL WAS NOT CONSIDERED TAXABLE COMPENSATION. CHARTER TRAVEL THE UNIVERSITY CHARTERS AIRCRAFT FOR THE PURPOSE OF TRANSPORTING THE BASKETBALL TEAM TO INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETIC EVENT LOCATIONS. TWO HIGHEST COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES TRAVELED ON THE CHARTERED FLIGHTS. IN INSTANCES WHERE A UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEE AND/OR THEIR FAMILY MEMBER TRAVELS ON A UNIVERSITY CHARTERED FLIGHT, WITHOUT A UNIVERSITY BUSINESS PURPOSE, THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE TAXABLE VALUE, WHICH MAY BE ZERO, OF THE CHARTERED TRAVEL PROVIDED TO THE EMPLOYEE AND/OR THEIR FAMILY MEMBER AND INCLUDES THE AMOUNT AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION OF THE EMPLOYEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Travel for companions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONE OFFICER AND ONE HIGHEST COMPENSATED EMPLOYEE HAD THEIR SPOUSES ACCOMPANY THEM ON A UNIVERSITY BUSINESS TRIP. THE COST OF THE TRAVEL WAS NOT CONSIDERED TAXABLE COMPENSATION TO THE EMPLOYEES. UNIVERSITY FUNDED EXPENSES FOR SPOUSES ARE TAXABLE COMPENSATION TO THE EMPLOYEE UNLESS THERE IS DOCUMENTED "BONA FIDE BUSINESS PURPOSE" FOR THE SPOUSE'S TRAVEL. UNDER LIMITED CIRCUMSTANCES, THE UNIVERSITY MAY APPROVE EXPENSES FOR AN EMPLOYEE'S SPOUSE. GENERALLY, THESE SITUATIONS ARE RELATED TO ALUMNI OR DONOR EVENTS WHERE DIRECT UNIVERSITY BENEFIT IS DERIVED FROM THE ATTENDANCE OF THE SPOUSE. IF A BONA FIDE BUSINESS PURPOSE DOES NOT EXIST, ANY AMOUNTS REIMBURSED OR PAID DIRECTLY FOR SPOUSAL EXPENSES ARE INCLUDED IN THE TAXABLE WAGES OF THE EMPLOYEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Housing allowance or residence for personal use
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONE OFFICER, ONE FORMER OFFICER, AND ONE KEY EMPLOYEE WERE PROVIDED A HOUSING ALLOWANCE IN CALENDAR YEAR 2023. THE HOUSING ALLOWANCE WAS CONSIDERED TAXABLE COMPENSATION TO THE EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Health or social club dues or initiation fees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONE OFFICER WAS EXTENDED A MEMBERSHIP IN A SOCIAL CLUB. THIS MEMBERSHIP WAS TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 4b Supplemental nonqualified retirement plan
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT, PROVOST, SENIOR VICE PRESIDENTS, VICE PRESIDENTS AND DEANS ARE ELIGIBLE TO PARTICIPATE IN A 457(B) NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN. THERE WERE FIVE OFFICERS , ONE KEY EMPLOYEE, ONE FORMER KEY EMPLOYEE, AND ONE HIGHEST COMPENSATED EMPLOYEE CONTRIBUTED TO THE PLAN IN CALENDAR YEAR 2023. THERE WERE NO DISTRIBUTIONS FROM THE PLAN IN CALENDAR YEAR 2023. THE PRESIDENT PARTICIPATED IN A 457(F) NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN DURING CALENDAR YEAR 2023. THE ASSOCIATED AMOUNT IS REPORTED IN SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN (C). THE CONTRIBUTION IS SUBJECT TO VESTING CONDITIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 7 Non-fixed payments
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO ONE LISTED IN PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A RECEIVED NON-FIXED PAYMENTS DURING CALENDAR YEAR 2023. ONE PERSON RECEIVED A PERFORMANCE BONUS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I PART I, COLUMN B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ITEMS REPORTED IN COLUMN B ARE A COMBINATION OF BOTH THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS AND NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I, Line 32b THIRD PARTIES USED TO SOLICIT, PROCESS, OR SELL NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS BROKERAGE RELATIONSHIPS TO FACILITATE THE PROCESSING AND SELLING OF SECURITIES RECEIVED FROM DONORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 4 Significant changes to organizational documents
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: During FY2024, LOYOLA made changes to its bylaws, including limiting the positions that would automatically be considered LOYOLA officers. Any listed officers with an asterisk by their name are no longer officers as of September 2023 due to this change, however they remain in their respective leadership positions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TAX MANAGER WORKS WITH A PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM TO COMPLETE A DRAFT FORM 990. THIS IS THEN REVIEWED IN DETAIL BY THE ASSISTANT VICE PRESIDENT TAX AND COMPLIANCE, CONTROLLER AND THE ACCOUNTING FIRM'S ENGAGEMENT MANAGEMENT TEAM. THE DRAFT FORM IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. ONCE A FINAL DRAFT VERSION OF THE FORM 990 HAS BEEN PRODUCED, IT IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE FINAL COMPLETE VERSION OF THE FORM 990 IS THEN DISTRIBUTED VIA THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SECURE WEBSITE TO ALL THE VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR, THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS UPDATED AS NECESSARY AND DISTRIBUTED TO ALL CURRENT OFFICERS, TRUSTEES, AND KEY EMPLOYEES, ALONG WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT. EVERY EFFORT IS MADE TO OBTAIN COMPLETED AND SIGNED DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS FROM ALL THOSE TO WHOM IT WAS DISTRIBUTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA THE UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE. GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VII, Section A, Line 1a OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, TRUSTEES, KEY & HIGHEST PAID EMPLOYEES
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FATHER THOMAS NEITZKE, S.J., IS A MEMBER OF THE SOCIETY OF JESUS AND HAS TAKEN A VOW OF POVERTY. DURING CALENDAR YEAR 2023, THE UNIVERSITY PAID COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS IN THE AMOUNT OF $206,183 TO THE SOCIETY OF JESUS, THE FOUNDERS OF LOYOLA UNIVERSITY CHICAGO, FOR HIS SERVICES. During FY2024 Loyola made changes to its bylaws and made revisions to what positions would be considered University Officers. Any listed officers with an asterisk by their name are no longer officers as of September 2023 due to this change, HOWEVER THEY REMAIN IN THEIR RESPECTIVE LEADERSHIP POSITIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VIII, Column (c) LINES 11B & 11C - CONFERENCE SERVICE AND FITNESS CENTER
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUSINESS REVENUES FOR CONFERENCE SERVICES AND FITNESS CENTER PRESENTED ON PART VIII ARE NET OF THE ASSOCIATED BUSINESS EXPENSES, AND CORRESPONDS TO INFORMATION PROVIDED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S FORM 990-T.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VIII, Line 11d Other Miscellaneous Revenue
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All other revenue - Total Revenue: 65575, Related or Exempt Function Revenue: , Unrelated Business Revenue: 65575, Revenue Excluded from Tax Under Sections 512, 513, or 514: ;

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part XI, Line 9 Other changes in net assets or fund balances
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Exchange Rate Gain/(Loss) - 23654; Changes in Post Retirement Benefit - -3453467; Loss on Property Disposals - -164343;

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 3(f) DESCRIPTION OF HOW EXPENDITURES ARE REPORTED
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WE MAINTAIN A SEPARATE SUB-LEDGER RELATED TO OUR ROME CENTER STUDY ABROAD CAMPUS, WHICH INCLUDES THE EXPENSES RELATED TO THAT PROGRAM. FOR STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS WHICH ARE CONDUCTED THROUGH OTHER EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS WE MAINTAIN SEPARATE ACCOUNTING UNITS WITHIN OUR GENERAL LEDGER IN ORDER TO TRACK THESE EXPENSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part II METHOD USED TO ACCOUNT FOR CASH GRANTS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANT ASSISTANCE IS RECOGNIZED WHEN THE EXPENSES ARE INCURRED. WE MAINTAIN A SEPARATE ACCOUNTING UNIT FOR EACH GRANT WITHIN OUR GENERAL LEDGER IN ORDER TO TRACK THESE EXPENSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, LINE 15 15A & 15B - PROCESS FOR DETERMINING EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Independent Review by Committee of Board of Trustees: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION HAS BEEN DOCUMENTED AND DISCUSSED AT LEAST ANNUALLY AT A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT OF THE UNIVERSITY PREPARES COMPARATIVE AND HISTORICAL INFORMATION FOR THE COMMITTEE TO REVIEW FOR EACH OF THE FOLLOWING POSITIONS: PRESIDENT, PROVOST, SVPs, VICE PRESIDENTS, AND SELECT OTHERS. Conduct Annual Market Benchmarking: THE INFORMATION PROVIDED INCLUDES A SALARY HISTORY, AN ANNUAL TOTAL COMPENSATION TALLY SHEET, A DETAILED COMPARISON OF COMPENSATION TO OTHER PEER INSTITUTIONS INCLUDING MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION OF JESUIT COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES (AJCU) AS WELL AS OTHER DOCTORAL INSTITUTIONS OF COMPARABLE SIZE. MOST OF THE COMPENSATION DATA COMES FROM THE COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION - HUMAN RESOURCES (CUPA-HR) ANNUAL SALARY SURVEY. Assess Organizational Performance: PRIOR TO THE MEETING, THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION DATA, ASSESSES PERFORMANCE, AND PROPOSES COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT. PRIOR TO THE MEETING, THE PRESIDENT REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION DATA OF THE OTHER EXECUTIVES, ASSESSES PERFORMANCE, AND PROPOSES COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVES. Compensation Package Approval: THESE PROPOSALS, ALONG WITH THE COMPARABILITY DATA, ARE THEN REVIEWED, DISCUSSED AND APPROVED AT THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MEETING. ADDITIONALLY, A SUMMARY REPORT OF THIS DATA AND COMPENSATION DECISIONS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES. HR Provides Transparency and Communicates with Stakeholders: THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT DOCUMENTS ALL OF THE APPROVALS AND DECISIONS MADE DURING COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MEETINGS, RETAINS A COPY OF REPORTS IN ITS FILES, AND PROCESSES ANY AND ALL CHANGES.
